headline: Airlines cutting fare is 'putting pressure' on low-cost carriers
summary: United Airlines (UAL) saw revenue from its premium business grow by 6% in the operator's third quarter, similar to Delta Air Lines' (DAL) own earnings boost it saw in thanks to premium travel bookings. Bloomberg Intelligence senior aerospace defense and airlines industry analyst George Ferguson comes on Market Catalysts to discuss how larger airlines are cutting airfare prices to better compete with low-cost carriers. Also catch George Ferguson explain why he believes United may have overloaded its capacity this past quarter. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

Also catch George Ferguson explain why he believes United may have overloaded its capacity this past quarter.
